title: Firefox 78.7.1 ESR 64bit failing to load in Windows 10 64 bit versions 2004 & 20H2
content:
Although Firefox 78.7.1 ESR 64bit does install under Windows 10 Home 64 bit Versions 2004 & 20H2, the application simply refuses to load displaying the Windows 10 rotating blue circle hinting of an underlying problem with Firefox, Task Manager confirms that Firefox is not loaded and hung as an application. Although Mozilla stipulates that Firefox 78 ESR is a Windows 10 compatible application, that compatibility must have ended with Windows 10 version 1909.

I run Windows 10 Home 64bit on a plain vanilla Intel Z170 chipset desktop computer, equipped with 64GB DDR4 2133 memory, AMD Firepro V4900 graphics card & no other exotic or esoteric component hardware .

That very same hardware previously ran Windows 7 Professional SP1 64 bit perfectly & ran Firefox 78.7.0 ESR without any issues.

I have therefore decided to drop the Mozilla ESR releases and go with the current version 85 instead which installs & runs perfectly under Windows 10 Home 64 bit in either version 2004 or 20H2. By the way I did configure Windows 10 Home to use Firefox as my default browser but since Firefox 78.7.1 ESR never managed to load and run properly I could not confirm if Firefox knew it was the default browser.

title: Firefox blank page - nothing works as cant even open developer tools or options
content:
Hi All,


Env: Windows 10 (Build 19041.264) Firefox version: 85.0.1 Antivirus: Symantec Endpoint Protection (latest updates as its a corporate laptop)

I have had this issue recently with Firefox (v85.0.1). All was working then suddenly one day the Firefox wont open any pages, it just stays blank. No google, no internal or external website. Tried the Private mode of Firefox and still the same. Cant even open Developer Tools. Cannot go to clear the cache or anything. Basically the Browser just sits blank. Cant click on reload button as its greyed out. Try to go and select 'Options' menu and nothing happens. Try about:config and does not work.

I saw some forums on Firefox forums itself suggesting possible possible malware, so I removed firefox, removed the folders from my user's AppData folder, run the symantec endpoint protection to be sure and no issues were found. Then reboot Windows and re-installed Firefox last week and it started to work. Today, I have hit the same problem again. So not sure whats going on. Anyone has faced something similar? Other browsers like Chrome and Edge are working okay.

title: How to display *.html.gz files in browser for local files
content:
I need to find a way to allow Firefox to display gzipped local files named like *.html.gz in the browser, for a new application I am working on.

Netscape 4.79 can do this, but it's very out-of-date and lacks modern Javascript and CSS support.

The behaviour of Firefox on local files named *.html.gz is to download them. Why? The files are already saved on the local disk...

Is there a configuration setting I can change to make Firefox display these files?

Ideally, ANY local file with a double extension of *1.*2.gz should be decompressed in the browser. Where *1 would be a name and *2 would be a file type that the browser can normally display (like HTML) or load (like Javascript/CSS,etc.).

If a user really does want to download a local file of this type, there could be a right click option like "Save Link As Uncompressed" or an option in Firefox config to switch this behaviour off.

Needing to run a webserver on the PC just so the browser can display compressed html is a bit ridiculous...
